main.name: Dmitry Kutin
main.description: Fourth Year Student at the University of Ottawa working towards a BSc with Honours in Computer Science, Management and Entrepreneurship Option
main.bio: Originally from Toronto, Ontario, a motivated young professional tooled towards web development with over a year of development experience using Git, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React.js, MySQL, with experience using C and Java for course work. When I'm not coding, I'm found at the gym, outdoors, or honing my chess skills.

education.degree: BSc Specialization in Computer Science, Management, Entrepreneurship Option
education.description: Classes in Data Structures and Algorithms, Operating Systems, Software Engineering, Discrete Structures, Computer Architecture and various core Business Management courses

work.title: Junior Web Developer
work.description: Full-Stack development with a medium sized development team working in an Agile environment employing scrum.
work.contribution: Assisting in developing key university websites using the Drupal 7 framework, migrating content and custom modules from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8, and development of a campus-wide emergency management notification system.

projects.title: Fantasy Tracker -- A Yahoo! API based application
projects.description: A work in progress: Created to show player trends in Yahoo! Fantasy Basketball -- customizable to each fantasy league and viewable on a centralized web page with DBMS for authenticated and non-authenticated users.
projects.contribution: Handling and calling APIs, storing them in a MySQL Database focused on backend with a PHP dominant codebase.

projects.title: My Portfolio Site
projects.description: This site was created with React.js, HTML, CSS, Javascript -- hosted on Github Pages. A showcase of my past work in my undergraduate degree and various personal projects I (somehow) found time to bring to life.
projects.contribution: Furthered my skills with HTML, CSS and JS. Experimented with UX/UI design in Adobe XD, able to implement my desired look and feel learning React.js
